meanings.definition: A unit of currency in France before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: In the past, a livre could buy many things in France.
meanings.sent2: She saved up all her livres to buy a special gift.
meanings.sent3: The piggy bank was filled with colorful livres, making it heavy.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was worth more than a thousand livres.
meanings.sent5: The sound of clinking livres filled the marketplace.

meanings.sent1: She enjoyed reading a livre before bedtime every night.
meanings.sent2: The library had a wide selection of livres on various topics.
meanings.sent3: The talking livre on the shelf made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a livre full of stories waiting to be read.
meanings.sent5: The smell of an old livre can transport you to another time.
